nodes.title: Mind Map Application Project
nodes.body: A comprehensive tool for creating and managing interactive mind maps.

nodes.title: Development Tools
nodes.body: Tools and languages used in the development, including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and LLMs.

nodes.title: JavaScript
nodes.body: The scripting language used to create dynamic content on the web.

nodes.title: HTML & CSS
nodes.body: Standard markup and styling languages used for creating and designing web pages.

nodes.title: Large Language Models (LLMs) in Development
nodes.body: LLMs, like GPT-3, provide coding assistance, enabling developers with varying levels of expertise to build complex applications.

nodes.title: Reference: LLMs and Coding
nodes.body: Medium, 2022. 'How AI is Transforming Software Development'. [Read Article](https://medium.com/topic/technology)

nodes.title: Core Functionalities
nodes.body: The essential features and functionalities implemented in the mind map application.

nodes.title: Advanced Features
nodes.body: Enhanced capabilities that improve the utility and efficiency of the mind map application.

nodes.title: User Interaction
nodes.body: Features and design choices that affect how users interact with the application.

nodes.title: Visual Studio Code
nodes.body: IDE used for developing the application, featuring extensions like Live Server.

nodes.title: GitHub
nodes.body: Used for version control and source code management throughout the project.

nodes.title: Node & Connection Management
nodes.body: Methods to add, remove, and manage nodes and connections within the mind map.

nodes.title: Zoom & Pan
nodes.body: Techniques implemented to navigate larger mind maps effectively.

nodes.title: Persistence & Data Storage
nodes.body: Strategies to save and restore the state of the mind map using local storage or server-based solutions.

nodes.title: Export/Import JSON
nodes.body: Functionality that allows users to export their mind map to JSON format and import it back.

nodes.title: Real-Time Collaboration
nodes.body: Potential future feature allowing multiple users to work on the same mind map simultaneously.

nodes.title: Data Analysis
nodes.body: LLMs analyze written content from books, articles, websites, and more to learn how humans use language.

nodes.title: Pattern Recognition
nodes.body: They detect patterns in data to understand grammar, context, and nuances in language.

nodes.title: Knowledge Representation
nodes.body: LLMs represent knowledge by organizing learned information in complex models, similar to a human mind organizing thoughts.

nodes.title: Application
nodes.body: Used in chatbots, translation services, and content creation, helping bridge communication gaps globally.

nodes.title: Overview of LLMs
nodes.body: OpenAI Blog, 2021. [Understanding LLMs](https://www.openai.com/blog/understanding-llms)

nodes.title: Deep Learning for Language Processing
nodes.body: Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research, Vaswani et al., 2017. 'Attention Is All You Need'. [Read here](https://www.jair.org/index.php/jair/article/view/11192)

nodes.title: Real-World Applications of AI
nodes.body: Medium, 2020. 'Exploring Practical Uses of AI'. [Access article](https://medium.com/topic/technology)
